Thank goodness he's legendary. At least he has one drawback to offset attacking for 6 with CMC 3.

Seriously really good. Sweepers, blockers or sac effects are your options to deal with him.

@Nago: Keep in mind the angel DOES have evasion, so you can still decide to swing him into a blocker and (usually) get four through. That's not too bad if you think of it in terms of what a Flames of the Blood Hand (a card that sees some play even in older formats) could do.

posts.post_content:
My older bro always finds these neat little cards and we contemplate ways how a single card can lead to sure victory. What is quickly realized though is that no single card will always lead to sure victory. Since we play casual using cards ranging from ye olden days to today, there's always a way to deal with a pest like Mr. Geist.  
  
 Mind Twist him out of your opponent's hand, or use a Hypie or a Duress or a Hymn to Tourach, etc. etc. Counterspell it, or Cancel or Essence Shatter or Mana Leak etc. etc. Wrath of God the battlefield, or Apocalypse everything out of existence even. Diabolic Edict or miss Liliana of the Veil (among a million other cards) are simple ways to force a sac. Fog or Safe Passage is always an annoying method. Your opponent have it enchanted or equipped with something to make it unblockable? Tranquility, Disenchant, Shatter, Naturalize, Smelt, etc. etc. can make it blockable again. Twiddle, Icy Manipulator, Downpour, Sleep, etc. are easy ways to keep him fr... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Continue (2/21/2013 4:58:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Downvoting this card simply because it represents the worst thing about Magic: The Gathering with the current model:  
  
This is a cheap, insanely powerful card, and it's mythic. If you're up against a deck using this, you're boned - you're taking at -least- four damage, and if not dealt with, you'll be dead inside of three turns.  
  
You need it to win if you're going to go W/U to reach top 4, maybe top 8. If you aren't playing this, you have no chance. Getting a set is $120 to your deck cost, and that's being generous.
posts.html:
Downvoting this card simply because it represents the worst thing about Magic: The Gathering with the current model:

This is a cheap, insanely powerful card, and it's mythic. If you're up against a deck using this, you're boned - you're taking at -least- four damage, and if not dealt with, you'll be dead inside of three turns.

You need it to win if you're going to go W/U to reach top 4, maybe top 8. If you aren't playing this, you have no chance. Getting a set is $120 to your deck cost, and that's being generous.
